abstracts.cdata!:
This Indigenous Peoples Plan (IPP)
            supports the overall objectives of the Sustainable
            Communities (AMAPA) Project for Brazil which are to assist
            the government of the State of Amapa in improving the living
            conditions of the urban and rural poor, the most vulnerable
            groups and poverty reduction strategies throughout the
            state. The IPP recommendations are: 1) support for urban
            productivity and economic sustainable activities; 2) access
            to credit from local banks, social services and basic
            infrastructure; 3) technical assistance to local government
            communities and community organizations for participation in
            decision making of local municipal governments and state
            policies; and 4) institutional strengthening to the
            government of the state of Amapa. Among the poor people of
            the State of Amapa there is a Social Special Group of four
            communities that will receive special attention, they are:
            a) indigenous people; b) rural communities where women are
            responsible of the household; c) unemployed youth; and d)
            remnants of Quilombo (groups of slave decendants)
            inhabitants do Curiau in the surrounding of the city of Macapa.
